sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Blinken welcomes Hamas' response to ceasefire efforts, while Israel confirms the death of 31 hostages in Gaza.

sentences.sentence: The EU's chief diplomat, Josep Borrell, is in Kyiv for a two-day visit, where he'll meet with Ukraine's President, Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Serbia's opposition protests as the new parliament is inaugurated despite reports of electoral fraud.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Israel confirms that 31 of the remaining 136 hostages in Gaza are dead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The IDF released footage of what they say are troops operating in western canyons in the Gaza Strip, as Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vowed to continue the war until total victory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Israel's army's spokesperson Hagari announced that the families of the hostages that have died have been notified.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The death of the hostages only adds pressure on the Israeli government and their handling of the war. The news came as U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken met with the leaders of Egypt and Qatar Tuesday, holding diplomatic talks to push ahead for a ceasefire. To which Qatar's Prime Minister said that Hamas gave a generally positive answer. Blinken will be discussing the proposal with Israel today.

sentences.sentence: We are reviewing that response now and I will be discussing it with the government of Israel tomorrow. There is still a lot of work to be done, but we continue to believe that an agreement is possible and indeed essential. And we will continue to work relentlessly to achieve it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In Gaza, Palestinians mourn and prayed by the side of people killed in recent strikes on the southernmost town of Rafah, the city previously designated a safe zone by the Israeli military and to where hundreds of thousands of Palestinians have fled.

sentences.sentence: thousands of Palestinians have fled. including President Volodymyr Zelensky. Meanwhile, two Russian missiles hit Ukraine's eastern region of Kharkiv, killing a two-month-old boy who was sounded under the rubble of a three-story hotel. The attack came as Director General of the International Atomic Energy Agency, Rafael Grossi,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: arrived in Ukraine to inspect Zaporizhzhia nuclear power station.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The aim of the visit is to assess the impact of recent Ukrainian personnel reductions after Ukrainian authorities who are occupying the facility denied them access.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The agency has repeatedly expressed alarm about the facility amid fears of a potential nuclear catastrophe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The EU's proposal to reduce the use of pesticides is the first to fall victim to farmers' protests.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The plan aimed to halve pesticide use by 2030 with the goal of reducing biodiversity loss.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It is the first defeat for the European Green Deal, the European Commission's flagship environmental policy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This is how Ursula von der Leyen announced a withdrawal of the law, known as SURE.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: The Commission proposed SURE, which is the worthy aim to reduce the risks of chemical plant production products.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: But the SURE proposal has become a symbol of polarisation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: It has been rejected by the European Parliament.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: There is no progress anymore in the Council either and that is why I will propose to the College to withdraw this proposal. The law already received a fatal blow last November when the European Parliament voted down its own position on the text leaving it with virtually no chance of going ahead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Negotiations between EU capitals were also at a deadlock.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The main farmers' organisation, Copacosceca, complained that the proposal imposed targets from a vote and was poorly designed, poorly evaluated, poorly financed and offered few alternatives to farmers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: It doesn't take into account the reality on the spot because all of us, I think, we want to reduce the use of chemical pesticides.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: But the question is what we put, what we replace with what, this kind of pesticides in order to give to the farmers the possibility to continue their work.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But increasing loss of biodiversity, including key pollinators for agriculture, cast doubt on whether this is the best move for the planet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Green parties believe it's not.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: They claim that it is in the name of the interests of the farmers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Well, I don't know whether farmers will see it the same way.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Of course, they are over-reliant on pesticides, but as you know, pesticides, there's a side thing in the word which means killer, right?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: So it can't be a good thing.

sentences.sentence: Farmers' protests continue to spread across Europe on Tuesday, after reaching Brussels last Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Buckingham Palace said King Charles III has begun receiving treatment and is expected to remain in London for the time being.

sentences.sentence: Before the king ascended the throne, there was talk of slimming down the royal family.

sentences.sentence: Prince William and Catherine are now the only working royals below for public events. Prince William and Catherine are now the only working royals below the age of 50. Catherine, a vital public face, often appearing on front pages, is currently recovering from an operation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: She won't return to work until after Easter. Despite his diagnosis, the King will maintain his constitutional role, handling paperwork and private meetings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: But the spotlight is now firmly on Prince William.

sentences.sentence: It is unsettling. The Queen's death was unsettling and I don't think we've recovered fully from the Queen's death.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
